title: Invalid Read on exif_process_SOFn
vulnerability_information:
This  bug is present in exif_scan_thumbnail method of ext/exif/exif.c file.

Detailed description and steps to reproduce for this bug is present in bug report submitted to php.net.
Bug Report : https://bugs.php.net/bug.php?id=77540
PHP version : 7.1.26
CVE-ID : 2019-9640

## Impact

This bug may allow an attacker to read unintended data from memory.
vulnerability_information_html:
This bug is present in exif_scan_thumbnail method of ext/exif/exif.c file.

Detailed description and steps to reproduce for this bug is present in bug report submitted to php.net.
Bug Report : https://bugs.php.net/bug.php?id=77540
PHP version : 7.1.26
CVE-ID : 2019-9640

Impact

This bug may allow an attacker to read unintended data from memory.

activities.message: Hey @chamal - Thanks for the submission. Your report is currently being reviewed and the HackerOne triage team will get back to you once there is additional information to share.

activities.message: Hi @tuxedo, Is there any updates on this report?

activities.message: Thank you @chamal! I was able to validate your report, and have submitted it to the appropriate remediation team for review. Please note that the status and severity are subject to change.

activities.message: Hi @tuxedo, It has been 7 months. But this issue is not reviewed yet. I have submitted 3 more PHP issues to Hackerone and they too are not reviewed.

activities.message:
Hi @tuxedo,
Today is 16th March, 2020. I reported this bug on 15th, March, 2020. One year has passed.
But this report is not resolved. At least I don't get an update on when this report will be resolved.
This is an extremely bad way to treat a user.

activities.message:
Dear Sir/Madam,

I am waiting more than a year now. But still this issue is not resolved.
Kindly resolve this report.

I have 4 unresolved reports with PHP(IBB).
1. 510336 - Mar 15th, 2019
2. 510025 - Mar 15th , 2019
3. 516237 - Mar 27th , 2019
4. 623588 - Jun 21st , 2019

Thanks,
Chamal.

activities.message:
Hello @chamal,

On behalf of the Internet Bug Bounty Panel, thank you for your continued patience on this report. The IBB requires that all in-scope open source projects be mutually engaged with us to ensure there is a good experience for all. Unfortunately, we have not been able to maintain that relationship with the upstream PHP community, and as a result, HackerOne and the IBB Panel have collectively agreed to shut down the program indefinitely.

In an effort to reward researchers for their hard work and patience thus far, the IBB panel has elected to pay bounties to all valid reports without PHP’s input. Bounty amounts are decided on based on the PHP policy and severity assigned on the accompanying CVE. 

As an act of good faith, we will also close this report as Resolved.

Thank you for helping keep the internet safe and secure!
-The Internet Bug Bounty Panel
